TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant , at the material time an employee of ORG ( the “ Institute ” ; PERSON гідрофізичний інститут Національної ORG ) , provided services of a typist and a linen - keeper on board the ORG 's ship , which was chartered by the private company “ ORG ” ( the “ Company ” ; Мале приватне підприємство “ Сата ” ) for international sea voyages . Pursuant the contract between ORG , the latter was responsible for the payment of trip allowances ( іноземна валюта взамін добових ) to the crew .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings in the NORP ORG of Sevastopil ( the “ ORG ” ; ORG районний суд PERSON ) against the Institute , seeking salary and trip allowance arrears in the amounts of CARDINAL NORP hryvnyas ( ORG ) and MONEY ( ORG ) respectively . The ORG was summoned to participate in the proceedings on the defendant 's side .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having heard the case in the ORG 's absence , allowed the applicant 's claims in full , having awarded her the salary arrears from the ORG and the trip allowance arrears from the Company . This decision became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG ( the “ ORG ” ; Севастопольський міський суд ) , following a “ protest ” lodged by its President , quashed the judgment of DATE in respect of the trip allowance award by way of supervisory review procedure and remitted the case for a fresh consideration in that respect . Particularly , the ORG found that ORG had insufficiently explored the contractual relationship between the parties and their payment obligations towards the applicant in the light of the applicable law .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having held one hearing for which only the applicant appeared , ordered the ORG , as her employer , to pay her the full amount claimed . The Company had not been summoned to participate in the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed this judgment on the ORG 's appeal in cassation and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . It found that ORG again had insufficiently explored the contractual relationship between the parties and that it should have summoned the Company to participate in the proceedings . The court further considered that it was not necessary for it to assume first - instance jurisdiction over the case , as the matter was not complex .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG returned the case - file to ORG . ORG summoned the Company to participate in the proceedings as a co - defendant and DATE scheduled CARDINAL hearings , CARDINAL of them being adjourned on account of a co - defendant 's absence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG heard the case in the ORG 's absence and found the Company liable to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL in trip allowance arrears converted into the national currency . In its reasoning the court referred to the provisions of the freight contract and partial payments made by the Company to this end . The Company appealed , but its appeal was returned as “ not lodged ” on account of its failures to comply with procedural formalities . The judgment became final .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the Company paid the applicant ORG CARDINAL of the award due .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE by way of supervisory review procedure , following a “ protest ” lodged by its President , and remitted the case for a fresh consideration to ORG . In particular , the ORG noted that ORG had not given due regard to the fact that the applicable law allowed the applicant to claim trip allowance from either her employer or the ship charterer , irrespective of the fact that the freight contract vested the payment obligation in the latter .

CARDINAL . DATE the court held QUANTITY hearings , CARDINAL of them adjourned on account of the applicant 's absence . On DATE ORG , having heard the testimonies of the parties and the ship captain , dismissed the applicant 's claims . In particular , it found that the documentary evidence necessary to establish the existence and amount of the debt was not in accordance with applicable accounting rules and therefore insufficient .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that the applicant 's appeal against the judgment of DATE did not comply with the requirements of procedural law and gave her a time - limit to rectify its shortcomings . On DATE ORG found that the applicant had insufficiently followed its instructions and returned the appeal to the applicant as “ not lodged ” . On DATE ORG upheld this decision on the applicant 's appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal in cassation against the decisions to return her appeal against the judgment of DATE as “ not lodged ” . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's request for leave to appeal in cassation .
